summary: A federal fund helps low-income families pay for child care while parents work or attend school. We've previously reported that states manage the high demand for these child care subsidies in various ways, including lowering income limits for eligibility and using wait lists. In 2018, Congress appropriated $5.2 billion for the fund—nearly twice the amount of the prior year. States have various plans for that...
title: Child Care and Development Fund: Subsidy Receipt and Plans for New Funds
